Using ukgeog to draw maps

Source: vignettes/maps.Rmd
maps.Rmd

ukgeog provides several read functions to provide the ability to easily download official spatial data sets of the UK as simple feature (sf) objects. A full list of the geographies available is provided here. Here we demonstrate how this makes it easy to make choropleth maps with base R, as well as with popular packages such as ggplot2, tmap and leaflet.

First we need to read in a spatial dataset as a simple feature (sf), here we choose to make use of read_admin to read in the countries that make up the UK:

library(ukgeog)

sf <- read_admin("NAT")

Note: crs = 4326 (the default) provides the most capatibility with other functions

Drawing maps with your simple feature

-plot-

plot(sf$geometry)

-ggplot2-

library(ggplot2)

ggplot(sf) + 
  geom_sf() +
  theme_void()

-tmap-

library(tmap)

qtm(sf)
#> Linking to GEOS 3.8.0, GDAL 3.0.4, PROJ 6.3.1

-leaflet-

library(leaflet)

leaflet(sf) %>% 
  addPolygons()
